name: Fathen
summaryHTML: Fathen is common in pastoral settings and disturbed/weedy areas. Pollen of this group are spherical in shape, small (26 â€“ 30 microns), and they are covered in numerous round holes (pores) giving them the appearance of a practice golf ball. Fathen pollen is most prominent in the air during the summer months.

name: Docs & sorrels
summaryHTML: Another weed type common in pastoral and disturbed areas. Pollen of dock & sorrel is slightly oblate in shape, small in size (21-25 microns) with 3 slit-like apertures around its middle. Like other weedy herb species, dock & sorrel pollen is most abundant in the air during the summer months.

name: Plantain
summaryHTML: A common herb in pastures and grassy areas. Plantain pollen grains are spherical, small in size (21-25 microns) with several round pore openings distributed across their surface. The pores have raised rims. Plantain pollen is most prominent in the air during the summer months.
